g.text: 1: Connecting two or more different audio files
6: changing frequency of the audio sample
and we will be working with .wav file format which contains raw data of audio
chunk size stores the size of every variable we define after this and also the size of actual pcm data
mainly taken as 32 bit integer as it can store a number up to 4 gb which is suffecnt for general audio files
we only need to check if a file is wav or not by checking chunk id and chunk format
what i have done till now
1: opened a .wav file and check its format for debugging
2: i skipped the header which contains data from which we can recognize the wav file
3: i made a array allocated it memory and stored raw pcm data in it
why storing pcm data in an array for easy
access to navigation of each bit
Pcm stands for pulse code modulation ..it is a technique to convert analog to digital signal
RIFF stands for resource interchange file format it is a file format used to store audio data with a header
the size of header is 44 bytes excludinf raw pcm data which is variable
if subchunksize id 60000 bytes then chunk size would be 60036 bytes
actual size + fmt chunk size+ format (which is 4 bytes)
chunk size does not include the size of itself (obvious and chunk id ) that,s why it only adds 36 to the actual size
as sizeof chunk id and chunk size is 4+4=8 bytes which adds upto 44 bytes in total
